intro: Euphorbia seguieriana var. nicaeensis, commonly known as the Nicaean euphorbia, is a succulent plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and leaves that are often covered in a waxy cuticle to reduce water loss. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters, which are typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
